gurmukhi: sXwm ko sMg sBY hm Kolq sIql pwtk kwib qtweI ]qaun smY suKdwiek QI irq Aausr Xwih BeI duKdweI ]871]
transliteration: Syaam Ko San Sabhai Ham Khelat Seetal Paatak Kaab(i) Tataaee|| Taoun Samai Soukhdaaik Thirit Aousar Yaah(i) Bhaidoukhdaaee||871||
translation: All of us played with Krishna splashing water on one another; that time was extremely comfort-giving, but now the same time has become agonising.871.

gurmukhi: jor GtwGn Awey jhwN sKI bUMdn myG BlI Cib pweI ]bolq cwqiRk dwdr Aau Gn morn pY GnGor lgweI ]
transliteration: Jor Ghataa-ghan Aae Jahaan Sakhiboondan Megh Bhalichhab(i) Paaee|| Dolat Chaatrik Daadar Au Ghan Moran Pai Ghanhor Lagadee||
translation: Look, O friend ! the clouds have surrounded us and it is a beautiful spectacle created by raindrops; the sound of cuckoo, peacock and frog is resounding;

gurmukhi: qwih smY hm kwnHr ky sMg Kylq QI Aiq pRym bFweI ]qaun smY suKdwiek QI irq Aausr Xwih BeI duKdweI ]872]
transliteration: Tah(i) Samai Ham Kaahnar Ke San Khelat Thiat(i) Prem Badhaaee|| Taoun Samai Soukhdaaeek Thirit Aousar Yaah(i) Bhaidoukhdaaee||872||
translation: In such a time we were absorbed with Krishna in amorous play; how much comfortable was that time and now this time is greatly distressing.872.

gurmukhi: myG prY kbhUM auGrY sKI Cwie lgY dRUm kI suKdweI ]sXwm ky sMg iPrY sjnI rMg PUln ky hm bsqR bnweI ]
transliteration: Megh Darai Kab-hoon Oughrai Sakhichhaad Lagad Droum Kisoukhdaaee|| Syaam Ke San Phirai Sajniran Phoolan Ke Ham Bastra Banaaee||
translation: Sometimes the clouds burst into rain and the shade of the tree appeared comfort-giving; we used to wander with Krishna, wearing the garments of flowers;

gurmukhi: Kylq kRIV krY rs kI ies Aausr kau brnXo nhI jweI ]sXwm smY suKdwiek QI irq sXwm ibnw Aiq BI duKdweI ]873]
transliteration: Khelat Krid Darai Ras Kiis Aousar Kau Barnyo Nahijaaee|| Syaam Samai Soukhdaaeek Thirit Syaam Binaa At(i) Bhidoukhdaaee||873||
translation: While roaming, we were absorbed in amorous play; it is impossible to describe that occasion; remaining with Krishna, that season has become distressing.873.

gurmukhi: mws AsU hm kwnHr ky sMg Kylq ic`q hulws bFweI ]kwnH qhwN pun gwvq Qo Aiq suMdr rwgn qwn bsweI ]
transliteration: Maas Asoo Ham Kaahnar Ke San Khelat Khelat Chitt Hulaas Badhaaee|| Kaabn Tahaan Poun Gadvat Tho At(i) Soundar Raagad Taan Basaaee||
translation: In the month of Ashvin, with great joy, we played with Krishna; being intoxicated Krishna used to play on (his flute) and produce tunes of charming musical modes,

gurmukhi: gwvq QI hmhUM sMg qwhI ky qw Cib ko brnXo nhI jweI ]qw sMg mY suKdwiek QI irq sXwm ibnw Ab BI duKdweI ]874]
transliteration: Gadvat Thiham-houn San Taahike Taa Chhab(i) Ko Barnyo Nahijaaee|| Taa San Mai Soukhdaaik Thirit Syaam Binaa Ab Bhidoukhdaaee||874||
translation: We sang with him and that spectacle is indescribable; we remained in his company; that season was pleasure-giving and now the same season has become distressing.874.

gurmukhi: kwqk kI sKI rws ibKY ruq Kylq QI hir so icq lweI ]syqhu g√çwrn ky pt Cwjq syq ndI qh Dwr bhweI ]
transliteration: Kaatak Kisakhiraas Bikhai Rout Khelat Thihar(i) So Chit Laaee|| Setauh Gvaaran Ke Pat Chhaadat Set Naditah Dhaar Bahaaee||
translation: In the month of Kartik, we, in delight, were absorbed in amorous play with Krishna; in the current of the white river, the gopis also wore white clothes;

gurmukhi: BUKn syqh gopn ky Aru moqnhwr BlI Cib pweI ]qaun smY suKdwiek QI irq Aausr Xwih BeI duKdweI ]875]
transliteration: Bhookhan Setah Gopan Ke Ar(u) Motanhaar Bhalichhab(i) Paaee|| Taoun Samai Soukhdaaik Thirit Aousar Yaah(i) Bhaidoukhdaaee||875||
translation: The gopas also wore white ornaments and necklaces of pearls; they all looked fine; that time was very comfortable and now this time has become extremely agonising.875.

gurmukhi: mGR smY sB sXwm kY sMg huie Kylq QI mn AwnMd pweI ]sIq lgY qb dUr krY hm sXwm ky AMg so AMg imlweI ]
transliteration: Moghra Samai Sabh Syaam Ke San Hue Khelat Thiman Aanand Paaee|| Seet Lagad Tab Door Darai Ham Syaam Ke An So An Milaaee||
translation: In the month of Maghar, in great pleasure, we used to play with Krishna; when we felt cold, we removed the coolness by blending our limbs with the limbs of Krishna;

gurmukhi: PUl cMbylI ky PUl rhy ijh nIr GtXo jmunw jIA AweI ]qaun smY suKdwiek QI irq Aausr Xwih BeI duKdweI ]876]
transliteration: Phool Channdelike Phool Rahe Jih Neer Ghatyo Jamounnda Jjeea Aaee|| Taoun Samai Soukhdaaik Thirit Aousar Yaah(i) Bhaidoukhdaaee||876||
translation: The flowers of jasmine are not blooming and in sorrow, the water of Yamuna has also decreased, O friend! the season alongwith Krishna was very joy-giving and this season is very troublesome.876.

gurmukhi: bIc sr`dRqu ky sjnI hm Kylq sXwm so pRIq lgweI ]AwnMd kY Aiq hI mn mY qjkY sB hI ijX kI duicqweI ]
transliteration: Beech Saraddrat9u) Ke Sajniham Khelat Syaam So Preet Lagadee|| Oonand Kai At(i) Himan Mai Taj-kai Sabh Hijiya Kidouchitaaee||
translation: In winter season, we all had been happy in the company of Krishna and removing all our doubts we were absorbed in the amorous play;
